_metadata.description: Global rules and file reference for Health context

project.name: Health
project.purpose: Provide consistent training, nutrition, and recovery guidance based on personal health data and goals.

time_anchor.rule: Convert relative time references to absolute dates using timeline.json temporal_anchor.profile_anchor_date.

deficit_policy.notes: All days are -400 kcal deficit. Saturdays are -800 kcal (easy ride day).

macro_policy.rule: Protein grams fixed. When adding calories (eat-back from exercise), allocate primarily to carbs. Fat stays fixed unless overridden.

eat_back_rule.note: Eat back 50% of exercise calories. Allocate to carbs.

context_files.nutrition-goals.json: Daily calorie targets, macros, meal distribution, exercise adjustments
context_files.eating-samples.json: Historical eating patterns, actual meals, weight trends
context_files.timeline.json: Anchor date, injury timeline, training phases, race date
context_files.profile.json: Baseline vitals, medical conditions, risk flags, constraints
context_files.lab-results.json: Blood work values, supplement guidance, risk context
context_files.medical-records.json: Diagnosis history, imaging results, bone density
context_files.recent-metrics.json: Last 2 weeks of HRV, sleep, training data + phase summaries
context_files.skincare.json: Skincare procedures, shaving protocol, product timing
context_files.strength-training.json: Weekly strength program by day of week
context_files.weekly-schedule.json: Workout block availability, optimal training windows
context_files.training-manifesto.json: Training philosophy, periodization, fueling rules, recovery
context_files.historical-baselines.json: PRs, race history, VDOT paces, fitness progression
context_files.inference-rules.json: Situational inference, implicit needs, day-of-week defaults

response_format_preferences.default: Start with what to do first. Then short reasoning. No filler.
